member.name: M:Catel.Data.IDataObjectBase.Validate
member.summary: Validates the current object for field and business rule errors.
member.remarks:
To check wether this object contains any errors, use the property.
This method does not force validation. This means that when the object is already validated, and no properties have been changed, no validation actually occurs since there is no reason for any values to have changed.

member.name: M:Catel.Data.DataObjectBase.InitializeCustomProperties
member.summary:
Allows the initialization of custom properties. This is a virtual method that is called inside the constructor before the object is fully constructed.
This might be considered as bad or as a hack, but it's a good way to be able to inject custom properties before any actual logic is handled by derived classes.
member.remarks: Only use when you really know what you are doing.

member.name: M:Catel.Data.DataObjectBase.Validate
member.summary: Validates the current object for field and business rule errors.
member.remarks:
To check wether this object contains any errors, use the property.
This method does not force validation. This means that when the object is already validated, and no properties have been changed, no validation actually occurs since there is no reason for any values to have changed.

member.name: T:Catel.DynamicEventListener
member.summary: Dynamic event listener which enables the subscription to events where the type of the handler is unknown. This class uses the ILGenerator to create the dynamic methods.
member.remarks:
Some parts in this class (with the instances and increments), but this is required to dynamically subscribe to an even that we do not know the handler of on forehand. Normally, you would do this via an anynomous delegate, but that doesn't work so the event delegate is created via ILGenerator at runtime.
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8122085/calling-an-instance-method-when-event-occurs/8122242#8122242.

member.summary: The log.

member.name: T:Catel.NotSupportedInSilverlightException
member.summary:
Exception in case the functionality is not supported in Silverlight.
Unfortunately, Silverlight misses a lot of functionality. When a feature is not supported in Catel, this is because the .NET Framework (or actually Silverlight) does not allow the code to handle that specific feature.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The reason why the feature is missing.

member.name: P:Catel.NotSupportedInSilverlightException.Reason
member.summary: Get the reason why the feature is not supported.
member.value: The reason why the feature is missing.

member.summary:
Gets all types from the assembly safely. Sometimes, the is thrown, and no types are returned. In that case the user must manually get the successfully loaded types from the .
This method automatically loads the types. If the occurs, this method will return the types that were loaded successfully.
This method automatically logs all loader exceptions. If the exceptions should not be logged, use the method.
member.returns: The array of successfully loaded types.

member.returns: The array of successfully loaded types.

member.name: T:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator
member.summary:
The service locator which is used to retrieve the right instances of interfaces.
The cool thing about this service locator is that it can use external containers (from example from Unity) to resolve types if the types are not registered in the container itself. To do this, use the following code:
var serviceLocator = ServiceLocator.Instance; serviceLocator.RegisterExternalContainer(myUnityContainer);
The service locator will use the external containers in case the current container does not contain the type. If the external containers also don't contain the type, there is one last way to resolve the type using the event. The event passes that contains the type the service locator is looking for. By setting the or in the handler, the service locator will resolve the type.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified interface type is registered.
member.returns: true if the specified interface type is registered; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Note that the actual implementation lays in the hands of the IoC technique being used.

member.remarks: Note that the actual implementation lays in the hands of the IoC technique being used.

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator.IsExternalContainerSupported(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified external container is supported by this .
member.returns: true if the external container type is supported; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator.RegisterExternalContainer(System.Object)
member.summary:
Registers an external container. This can be an external IoC container such as a Unity container.
Registering an external container in the service locator is very useful in case types are already registered in another container (in case of Prism, for example).
The will use the external container to resolve unregistered types.
Use the to check whether an external container is registered before registering it (otherwise this method will thrown an exception).

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator.RegisterExternalContainerHelper(Catel.IoC.IExternalContainerHelper)
member.summary:
Registers an implementation of the class.
This method can be used to add support for new external IoC containers.

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator.ExportInstancesToExternalContainers
member.summary:
Exports all the current instances of the services to the external containers. This means that non-instantiated services will not be exported.
This method will only export services if the services are not already registered with the external container.

member.name: M:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator.ExportToExternalContainers
member.summary:
Exports all services to external containers. If a service is not yet instantiated, the instance will be registered with the external container. Otherwise, the type will be registered.
This method will only export services if the services are not already registered with the external container.

member.name: P:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator.AutomaticallyKeepContainersSynchronized
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the service locator should keep the external containers in sync with the current .
This means that after every call to one of the following methods:
*
*
*
*
*
this class will automatically invoke the method.
By default, this value is true.
member.value: true if the service locator should keep all containers synchronized; otherwise, false.

member.name: E:Catel.IoC.IServiceLocator.MissingType
member.summary:
Occurs when a type cannot be resolved the by service locator. It first tries to raise this event.
If there are no handlers or no handler can fill up the missing type, an exception will be thrown by the service locator.

member.name: T:Catel.IO.Path
member.summary: Static class that implements some path methods

member.name: M:Catel.IO.Path.GetApplicationDataDirectory
member.summary:
Gets the application data directory for the company and product as defined the the assembly information of the entry assembly. If the entry assembly is null, this method will fall back to the calling assembly to retrieve the information. If the folder does not exist, the folder is automatically created by this method.
This method returns a value like [application data]\[company]\[product name].
member.returns: Directory for the application data.

member.name: M:Catel.IO.Path.GetApplicationDataDirectory(System.String)
member.summary:
Gets the application data directory for a specific product. If the folder does not exist, the folder is automatically created by this method.
This method returns a value like [application data]\[product name].
member.returns: Directory for the application data.

member.name: M:Catel.IO.Path.GetApplicationDataDirectory(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Gets the application data directory for a specific product of a specific company. If the folder does not exist, the folder is automatically created by this method.
This method returns a value like [application data]\[company]\[product name].
member.returns: Directory for the application data.

member.remarks: This method will always strip the trailing backslash from the parent.

member.name: M:Catel.IO.Path.GetRelativePath(System.String)
member.summary:
Returns a relative path string from a full path.
The path to convert. Can be either a file or a directory The base path to truncate to and replace
Lower case string of the relative path. If path is a directory it's returned without a backslash at the end.
Examples of returned values: .\test.txt, ..\test.txt, ..\..\..\test.txt, ., ..
member.param: Full path to convert to relative path.
member.returns: Relative path.
member.remarks: This method internally uses the method, but passes null for the basePath parameter.

member.name: M:Catel.IO.Path.GetRelativePath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Returns a relative path string from a full path.
The path to convert. Can be either a file or a directory The base path to truncate to and replace
Lower case string of the relative path. If path is a directory it's returned without a backslash at the end.
Examples of returned values: .\test.txt, ..\test.txt, ..\..\..\test.txt, ., ..
member.param: Full path to convert to relative path.
The base path (a.k.a. working directory). If this parameter is null or empty, the current working directory will be used.
member.returns: Relative path.

member.param: Relative path to convert to a full path.
member.returns: Full path.

member.name: T:Catel.Logging.LogManager
member.summary:
Log manager that allows external libraries to subscribe to logging of Catel.
The manager automatically adds an instance of the to the list of listeners so the tracing is available in debug mode. To remove this listener, call before doing any initialization.

member.summary: List of all registered instances.

member.name: M:Catel.Logging.LogManager.RegisterDebugListener
member.summary:
Registers the default debug listener. Starting with Catel 2.4, the debug listener is no longer attached for performance reasons. To register the debug listener, call this method.
When an instance of the is already registered, the existing instance is returned.
This method does not ignore Catel logging.
member.returns: The newly created or existing .

member.name: T:Catel.Messaging.IMessageMediator
member.summary:
The interface definition for our Message mediator. This allows loose-event coupling between components in an application by sending messages to registered elements.
This class implements the mediator pattern.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.IMessageMediator.Register``1(System.Object,System.Action{``0})
member.summary: Registers a specific recipient for a specific message.
member.returns: true if the handler is registered successfully; otherwise false.
member.remarks: A handler cannot be registered twice. If the same handler is already registered, this method will return false.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.IMessageMediator.Register``1(System.Object,System.Action{``0},System.Object)
member.summary: Registers a specific recipient for a specific message.
member.returns: true if the handler is registered successfully; otherwise false.
member.remarks: A handler cannot be registered twice. If the same handler is already registered, this method will return false.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.IMessageMediator.Unregister``1(System.Object,System.Action{``0})
member.summary: Unregisters a specific recipient for a specific message.
member.returns: true if the handler is unregistered successfully; otherwise false.
member.remarks: A handler cannot be unregistered when it is not registered first. If a handler is unregistered while it is not registered, this method will return false.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.IMessageMediator.Unregister``1(System.Object,System.Action{``0},System.Object)
member.summary: Unregisters a specific recipient for a specific message with the specified tag.
member.returns: true if the handler is unregistered successfully; otherwise false.
member.remarks: A handler cannot be unregistered when it is not registered first. If a handler is unregistered while it is not registered, this method will return false.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.IMessageMediator.SendMessage``1(``0)
member.summary:
Broadcasts a message to all message targets for a given parameter type.
If a derived type is passed, any handlers for interfaces or base types will also be invoked.
member.returns: true if any handlers were invoked; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.IMessageMediator.SendMessage``1(``0,System.Object)
member.summary: Broadcasts a message to all message targets for a given message tag and passes a parameter.
member.returns: true if any handlers were invoked; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Catel.Messaging.IMessageMediator.CleanUp
member.summary:
Cleans up the list of registered handlers. All handlers that are no longer alive are removed from the list.
This method is automatically invoked after each call to , but can also be invoked manually.

The message handlers are organized using string-based message keys and are held in a WeakReference collection.

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.IAuthenticationProvider
member.summary: Interface to allow an authentication mechanism to control the CanExecute state of a command.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.IAuthenticationProvider.CanCommandBeExecuted(Catel.MVVM.ICatelCommand,System.Object)
member.summary:
Determines whether the specified can be executed. The class implementing this interface can use any required method to check the command.
It is recommended to use the property to identify a command.
member.returns: true if the specified command can be excecuted; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The CanExecute state of a command is queried a lot. The command itself does not cache any results because it is not aware of role or identity changes. If caching is required, this must be implemented in the class implementing the interface.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.IAuthenticationProvider.HasAccessToUIElement(System.Windows.FrameworkElement,System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary:
Determines whether the user has access to the specified . This method is invoked by the Authentication behavior, and can be used to disable or hide UI elements based on a role or any other authentication mechanism.
This method will only be called for UI elements with the Authentication behavior.
member.param: The authentication tag specified by the calling object.
member.returns: true if the user has access to the specified UI element; otherwise, false.

Gets the tag for this command. A tag is a way to link any object to a command so you can use your own methods to recognize the commands, for example by ID or string.
By default, the value is null.

Note that the services inside Catel do not support , thus you cannot subscribe to changes of this property. Instead, subscribe to the event.

member.summary: Updates the status text.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.IPleaseWaitService.UpdateStatus(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Updates the status and shows a progress bar with the default status text. The percentage will be automatically calculated.
The busy indicator will automatically hide when the is larger than .

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.IPleaseWaitService.UpdateStatus(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary:
Updates the status and shows a progress bar with the specified status text. The percentage will be automatically calculated.
The busy indicator will automatically hide when the is larger than .
When providing the , it is possible to use {0} (represents current item) and {1} (represents total items).
member.param: The status format. Can be empty, but not null.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.IPleaseWaitService.Hide
member.summary: Hides this please wait window.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.IPleaseWaitService.Push
member.summary:
Increases the number of clients that show the please wait window. The implementing class is responsible for holding a counter internally which a call to this method will increase.
As long as the internal counter is not zero (0), the please wait window will stay visible. To decrease the counter, make a call to .
A call to or one of its overloads will not increase the internal counter. A call to will reset the internal counter to zero (0) and thus hide the window.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.IPleaseWaitService.Push(System.String)
member.summary:
Increases the number of clients that show the please wait window. The implementing class is responsible for holding a counter internally which a call to this method will increase.
As long as the internal counter is not zero (0), the please wait window will stay visible. To decrease the counter, make a call to .
A call to or one of its overloads will not increase the internal counter. A call to will reset the internal counter to zero (0) and thus hide the window.
member.param: The status to change the text to.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.IPleaseWaitService.Pop
member.summary:
Decreases the number of clients that show the please wait window. The implementing class is responsible for holding a counter internally which a call to this method will decrease.
As long as the internal counter is not zero (0), the please wait window will stay visible. To increase the counter, make a call to .
A call to or one of its overloads will not increase the internal counter. A call to will reset the internal counter to zero (0) and thus hide the window.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.Services.IUIVisualizerService.NamingConventions
member.summary:
Gets or sets the naming conventions to use to search for views.
By adding or removing conventions to this property, the service can use custom resolving of views.
By default, the following conventions are added:
* /Views/[VM]View.xaml
* /Views/[VM]Control.xaml
* /Views/[VM]Page.xaml
* /Views/[VM]Window.xaml
* /Controls/[VM]Control.xaml
* /Pages/[VM]Page.xaml
* /Windows/[VM]Window.xaml
* /UI/Views/[VM]View.xaml
* /UI/Views/[VM]Control.xaml
* /UI/Views/[VM]Page.xaml
* /UI/Views/[VM]Window.xaml
* /UI/Controls/[VM]Control.xaml
* /UI/Pages/[VM]Page.xaml
* /UI/Windows/[VM]Window.xaml

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.Services.NamingConvention
member.summary: Class that is able to resolve naming conventions.

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.Services.NamingConvention.ViewModelName
member.summary:
The view model name constant that will be replaced by the naming convention. This constant will be replaced by the view model name without the "ViewModel" prefix.
For example, the following naming convention: [AS].UI.Views.[VM]View
will result in the following view for ExampleViewModel: MyAssembly.UI.Views.ExampleView.xaml

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.Services.NamingConvention.Assembly
member.summary:
The assembly constant that will be replaced by the naming convention. This constant will be replaced by the assembly name.
For example, the following naming convention: [AS].UI.Views.[VM]View
will result in the following view for ExampleViewModel: MyAssembly.UI.Views.ExampleView.xaml

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.NamingConvention.ResolveByViewModelName(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Resolves the convention by using the view model name.
This method does not add assemblies or resolve types, but will only return a string containing the resolved value based on the convention.
The following constants can be used in this method: *
member.param: The assembly which is the base namespace.
Class name of the view model. This parameter must only contain the type name, not the full type. For example ExampleViewModel.
member.returns: The resolved convention.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.Services.NamingConvention.ResolveNamingConvention(System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.String},System.String)
member.summary: Resolves the naming convention.
member.param: The constants with values. The Key must be the constant as it will be used inside the convention. The Value is the value the constant must be replaced with.
member.returns: The resolved convention.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.ExposeAttribute.PropertyNameOnModel
member.summary:
Gets or sets the name of the property on the model. If the is not the same as the name of the property on the model, this can be used to map the properties.
By default, the value is the same as the .
In this example, the name of the property to map on the model is first_name, but it must be available as FirstName on the view model.
[Model] [Expose("FirstName", "first_name")] public Person Person { get; set; }

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.ExposeAttribute.Mode
member.summary:
Gets or sets the mode of the mapping.
The default value is .

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.ModelAttribute.SupportIEditableObject
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the interface should be used on the model if possible.
The default value is true.
member.value: true if the interface should be used on the model if possible; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.ValidationToViewModelAttribute
member.summary: Attribute to gather validation from a in a property, which must be of type .
member.example:
The attribute must be used like this and all validations with the tag PersonValidationTag will be gathered into the summary:
[ValidationToViewModel("PersonValidationTag")] public IValidationSummary PersonValidationSummary { get; set; }
member.remarks: This attribute can only be used inside a view model.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.ValidationToViewModelAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.ValidationToViewModelAttribute.IncludeChildViewModels
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the validation of the child view models should also be included.
The default value is false.
member.value: true if the validation of the child view models should also be included; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.ValidationToViewModelAttribute.UseTagToFilter
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether this attribute should use the tag to filter the validation.
If the value is true, the validation will be filtered on the tag. Otherwise, all validation results will be returned. Keep in mind that the can still be null, even when this value is true.
The default value is true.
member.value: true if [use tag to filter]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.ValidationToViewModelAttribute.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets the tag to filter by.

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelToModelMode
member.summary: Specifies the different mapping modes available for the .

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelToModelMode.TwoWay
member.summary: Automatically maps the property from view model to model and back as soon as either one changes the property value.

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelToModelMode.OneWay
member.summary:
Automatically maps the property from the model to the view model if the model changes the property value.
This mode does not map any values from the view model to the model, thus can also be seen as read-only mode.

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelToModelMode.OneWayToSource
member.summary:
Automatically maps the property from the view model to the model if the view model changes the property value.
This mode does not map any values from the model to the view model, but still keeps track of all validation that occurs in the model.

member.name: F:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelToModelMode.Explicit
member.summary: Automatically maps properties from the model to the view model as soon as the is initialized. As soon as a property value changes in the model, the view model value is updated instantly. However, the mapping from the view model to model is explicit.

member.name: T:Catel.MVVM.IViewModel
member.summary: View model interface.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.IViewModel.InitializeViewModel
member.summary:
Initializes the view model. Normally the initialization is done in the constructor, but sometimes this must be delayed to a state where the associated UI element (user control, window, ...) is actually loaded.
This method is called as soon as the associated UI element is loaded.
member.remarks:
It's not recommended to implement the initialization of properties in this method. The initialization of properties should be done in the constructor. This method should be used to start the retrieval of data from a web service or something similar.
During unit tests, it is recommended to manually call this method because there is no external container calling this method.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.IViewModel.ValidateViewModel
member.summary: Validates the data.
member.returns: true if validation succeeds; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.IViewModel.ValidateViewModel(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Validates the specified notify changed properties only.
member.param: if set to true, a validation is forced (even if the object knows it is already validated).

if set to true only the properties for which the warnings or errors have been changed will be updated via ; otherwise all the properties that had warnings or errors but not anymore and properties still containing warnings or errors will be updated.
member.returns: true if validation succeeds; otherwise false.
member.remarks: This method is useful when the view model is initialized before the window, and therefore WPF does not update the errors and warnings.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelBaseWithoutServices.InitializeViewModel
member.summary:
Initializes the view model. Normally the initialization is done in the constructor, but sometimes this must be delayed to a state where the associated UI element (user control, window, ...) is actually loaded.
This method is called as soon as the associated UI element is loaded.
member.remarks:
It's not recommended to implement the initialization of properties in this method. The initialization of properties should be done in the constructor. This method should be used to start the retrieval of data from a web service or something similar.
During unit tests, it is recommended to manually call this method because there is no external container calling this method.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelBaseWithoutServices.Initialize

member.remarks:
It's not recommended to implement the initialization of properties in this method. The initialization of properties should be done in the constructor. This method should be used to start the retrieval of data from a web service or something similar.
During unit tests, it is recommended to manually call this method because there is no external container calling this method.

member.name: M:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelBaseWithoutServices.ValidateViewModel(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Validates the specified notify changed properties only.
member.param: if set to true, a validation is forced (even if the object knows it is already validated).

if set to true only the properties for which the warnings or errors have been changed will be updated via ; otherwise all the properties that had warnings or errors but not anymore and properties still containing warnings or errors will be updated.
member.returns: true if validation succeeds; otherwise false.
member.remarks: This method is useful when the view model is initialized before the window, and therefore WPF does not update the errors and warnings.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelBaseWithoutServices.InvalidateCommandsOnPropertyChanged
member.summary:
Gets a value indicating whether the commands should automatically be invalidated on a property change.
If this property is false, properties should either be invalidated by the .NET Framework or by a manual call to the method.
member.value: true if the commands should automatically be invalidated on a property change; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelBaseWithoutServices.DeferValidationUntilFirstSaveCall
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether all validation should be deferred until the first call to .
If this value is true, all validation will be suspended. As soon as the first call is made to the , the validation will no longer be suspended and activated.
The default value is false.
member.value: true if the validation should be deferred; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: If this value is used, it must be set as first property in the view model because the validation kicks in immediately when properties change.

member.name: P:Catel.MVVM.ViewModelBaseWithoutServices.ValidateModelsOnInitialization
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to validate the models as soon as they are initialized. This means that as soon as a model value is set, the view model checks whether the entity already contains errors.
If this value is true, the errors will immediately be returned for mappings on the model. Otherwise, the errors will only become available when a value is entered and then being undone.
The default value is true.
member.value: true if the models should be validated on initialization; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether models that implement are supported correctly.
member.value: true if models that implement are supported correctly; otherwise, false.

member.summary:
Updates the default errors. This method is required when errors are initialize via . This method checks whether default errors were added for a specific property (or at entity level if is or null).
Reason for this is that if the error is known on forehand, the implementation will not raise the event.
If the default errors are cleared, the validation via will take over from this point.

member.name: M:Catel.Runtime.Serialization.RedirectDeserializationBinder.#ctor
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the class.
Creates a custom binder that redirects all the types to new types if required. All properties decorated with the will be redirected.
member.remarks: This constructor searches for attributes of the current application domain.

member.name: M:Catel.Runtime.Serialization.RedirectDeserializationBinder.#ctor(System.AppDomain)
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the class.
Creates a custom binder that redirects all the types to new types if required. All properties decorated with the will be redirected.
member.remarks: This constructor searches for attributes in a specific application domain.

member.name: M:Catel.Runtime.Serialization.RedirectDeserializationBinder.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the class.
This method automatically loads all the assemblies into the current AppDomain and then uses the constructor.
Creates a custom binder that redirects all the types to new types if required. All properties decorated with the will be redirected.
member.param: Array of assembly locations that should be searched.
member.remarks:
This constructor searches for attributes in specific assemblies.
No exceptions are caught during the loading of the assemblies. The caller is responsible for handling the exceptions correctly.

member.name: M:Catel.Runtime.Serialization.RedirectDeserializationBinder.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Reflection.Assembly})
member.summary:
Initializes a new instance of the class.
Creates a custom binder that redirects all the types to new types if required. All properties decorated with the will be redirected.
member.param: Array of assembly locations that should be searched.
member.remarks: This constructor searches for attributes in specific assemblies.

Array of attributes to search for.

member.summary: Interface defining a method accepting an object parameter. This allows the execution of generic objects in a non-generic way.

member.name: M:Catel.IExecuteWithObject.ExecuteWithObject(System.Object)
member.summary:
Executes the object with the object parameter.
The class implementing this interface is responsible for casting the to the right type and to determine whether null is allowed as parameter.
member.returns: true if the action is executed successfully; otherwise false.
